group.p: Please select if your computer is a Windows machine or an Apple Mac

separator.string: Windows Add-in files ready for download

group.p: Save the files to your Downloads folder. Open the Properties of the files and uncheck the Blocked indicator when it is set. Close Excel if it is opened. Now move only the file Odoo-reports.xlam to a folder of choice or the official folder for Add-ins C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\AddIns. The AppData folder is a hidden folder. To make it visible in the File Explorer, select View in the menu and enable the Hidden Items option. Leave the .exe file in the Downloads folder.

Start Excel when the Add-in file is in the designated folder. In Excel choose File - Options - Add-ins. At the bottom you will see 'Manage: Excel Add-ins'. Select 'Excel Add-ins' when not already selected and click 'Go...'. You should see Odoo-Reports in the list (or use Browse...); select it to activate. Now you should see an Odoo section in the ribbon (within 'Home').

The OdooJsonToCsv executable is a tool to convert data received from Odoo (in Json format) to a CSV format which can be loaded by Excel. It can do this much faster than the Excel Add-in itself. Leave this file in the Downloads folder, the Add-in will pick it up from there.

separator.string: Mac Add-in files ready for download

group.p: Save the files to your Downloads folder. Get the file info and uncheck the Locked indicator when it is set. Within Excel choose Tools - Add-ins. Un-select the Odoo-Reports Add-in first when you are updating to the latest version. Then use Browse... and select the Add-in file. Excel will then copy the file to a hidden folder. Now you should see Odoo-Reports being selected. In the Home ribbon you should see three buttons: 'Get Index', 'Get Reports' and 'Settings'.

In Excel, from the Odoo menu click Settings. Check the settings, verify your username and enter your password. Click Test to validate and click OK to save. Now click Get Index to get an overview of available reports. Select reports by marking them in column B with a character (x for example). You may need to select the scope for some reports, for example select the relevant projects when the report is about projects. Then click Get Reports to get the reports which will appear on separate worksheets.

The OdooJsonToCsv executable is a tool to convert data received from Odoo (in Json format) to a CSV format which can be loaded by Excel. It can do this much faster than the Excel Add-in itself. Because of security measures the executable can't be called directly from the Add-in. You must create a Mac Script using the Script Editor (in the Applications - Utilities folder). Create a script with the name OdooJsonToCsvScript. Put the following code into the script and save it:
group.pre: on OdooJsonToCsvHandler(ParamString) do shell script "~/Downloads/OdooJsonToCsv " & ParamString return "Handler completed" end OdooJsonToCsvHandler
group.p: Next, you need to set the 'executable' indicator of the file. Open a Terminal session and change your working directory to ~/Downloads. Enter the command: chmod +x OdooJsonToCsv. As this program is not registered by Apple you must allow execution via the 'Gatekeeper'. Enter the command: spctl â€“ add /Users/<username>/Downloads/OdooJsonToCsv. Replace <username> by your own username. You will see a pop-up where you must enter you Mac user's password to confirm. After these steps you can close your terminal session and start using the Excel Add-in.
